It typically grows in shallow, freshwater environments such as ponds and wetlands. The plant has a rosette-like structure with leaves that are flat and floating or submerged, depending on the species. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, often clustered in dense inflorescences. Limnaspidium scutellatum plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat and food for various water organisms.
